project_descr: Promote the integration of CC & DRR capacity and concepts into broader development planning, and, to establish mechanisms to provide greater autonomy to establish partnerships and common DRR capacities

outputs.output_descr: South-south cooperation: The main pillar of the project is south-south cooperation pilot project, whereby the Cuban model of Risk Reduction Management Centres (RRMC) are shared, adapted and implemented in 3-5 pilot countries. The RRMC model stresses the need to equip and build capacity at a local level in order to carry out local assessments of risk, produce hazard and risk maps, and compile information from different actors in a territory in order that decision-makers can make informed decisions in a potentially hazardous situation. RRMCs also form a focus point for managing and communicating

Improved knowledge management on CCA and DRR:  This output is more clearly formulated around four indicators, which include integration of CCA & DRR, planning for recovery and seismic risk as emergent themes, gender and sharing of best practices between and across regions. The 4 activity results areas are aligned coherently with the indicators, as are the output targets with progressive and complementary logic evident between the activity result areas

This output area is focuses on building partnerships with inter/regional stakeholders, actors and donors, as well as ensuring the project management. The budget reflects existing resources and highlights the areas requiring additional support for effective project administration and guidance.

project_title: caribbean risk management initiative phase ii
